moves.1. g3: Benko's Opening.  The leading responses (d5, e5, Nf6, g6, & c5) all tend to be pretty good for black.
moves.1... c5 2. Bg2: The database favors Nc6 as a response.
moves.3... Nf6 4. f4 exf4 5. exf4 d6 6. b3 Bg4: Uh, retreat is a bad idea here because BxB, NxB, QxN and white comes out ahead in this exchange 3 points.  BxBf3 would have been better.  QxB, Nc6 (to prevent QxPb7).
Here white is setting up for QxPg7#.  Black should respond with Bf6 or possibly Pg6.
